actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of Thursday, March 6, 2025,  the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of Thursday, March 6, 2025, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S. 331 (Sen. Cassidy):
        A bill to amend the Controlled Substances Act with respect to the scheduling of fentanyl-related substances, and for other purposes.

        -- Motion to proceed to measure considered in Senate.

        -- Motion to proceed to consideration of measure agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Measure laid before Senate by motion.
 

 S.Amdt. 1237 (Sen. Grassley):
        To improve the bill.

        --Amendment SA 1237 proposed by Senator Thune for Senator Grassley.

PN11-4:
        Lori Chavez-DeRemer, of Oregon, to be Secretary of Labor

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 67 - 32. Record Vote Number: 111 



 PN12-42:
        Keith Sonderling, of Florida, to be Deputy Secretary of Labor

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN19:
        Stephen Miran, of New York, to be Chairman of the Council of Economic Advisers

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.
By unanimous consent, on the request of Mr. Moreno, at  7:17 p.m., the Senate recessed, under its order of today, until 10 a.m. tomorrow.
